workout_title: Beginner's Triceps and Shoulders Strength Session

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, arms extended to the sides.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Make small circles with your arms, gradually increasing the size. Reverse the direction halfway through.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand or sit, raise one arm overhead and bend the elbow.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Use the opposite hand to gently push the elbow back, stretching the triceps. Hold and switch sides.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, arms relaxed by your sides.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Roll your shoulders forward in a circular motion, then reverse the direction.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, arms extended in front.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Swing your arms back and forth across your chest, alternating the top arm.

exercises.setup: Position the cable at a low setting and use a bar attachment. Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms overhead.
execution: 1. Grip the bar with both hands and stand with your back to the cable machine.
2. Extend your arms overhead, keeping your elbows close to your head.
3. Bend your elbows to lower the bar behind your head, feeling a stretch in your triceps.
4. Extend your elbows to return to the starting position, keeping tension on the triceps throughout.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Attach a rope to the low pulley of a cable machine. Stand facing away from the machine, holding the rope with both hands overhead.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Grip the rope with both hands and stand with your back to the cable machine.
2. Extend your arms overhead, keeping your elbows close to your head.
3. Bend your elbows to lower the rope behind your head, feeling a stretch in your triceps.
4. Extend your elbows to return to the starting position, keeping tension on the triceps throughout.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Use a resistance band that provides similar tension to the cable setup.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on keeping your elbows stationary to maximize the stretch and contraction of the triceps.

exercises.setup: Use an EZ bar or straight bar. Lie on a bench with the bar overhead.
execution: 1. Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor.
2. Hold the EZ bar with an overhand grip, arms extended above your chest.
3. Bend your elbows to lower the bar towards your forehead, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Extend your elbows to lift the bar back to the starting position.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with good form, typically around 50-60% of 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended overhead.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Sit on a bench with your back supported.
2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended overhead.
3. Bend your elbows to lower the dumbbells behind your head.
4. Extend your elbows to return to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select dumbbells that allow for 10-12 reps with good form, typically around 50-60% of 1RM.
exercises.additional_tips: Keep your elbows tucked in to prevent them from flaring out, which helps target the triceps more effectively.

exercises.setup: Sit on a bench with back support, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height.
execution: 1. Sit on a bench with your back supported and feet flat on the floor.
2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height, palms facing forward.
3. Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height with control.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with good form, typically around 50-60% of 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit on a bench with back support, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Sit on a bench with your back supported and feet flat on the floor.
2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height, palms facing forward.
3. Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height with control.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose dumbbells that allow for 10-12 reps with good form, typically around 50-60% of 1RM.
exercises.additional_tips: Keep your core engaged to support your back and prevent arching during the press.

exercises.setup: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand by your sides.
execution: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand by your sides.
2. Raise the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor.
3. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and your palms facing down.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position with control.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with good form, typically around 50-60% of 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Stand next to a cable machine with the handle set at the lowest position.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Stand next to a cable machine with the handle set at the lowest position.
2. Hold the handle with the hand furthest from the machine.
3. Raise your arm out to the side until it is parallel to the floor.
4. Lower the handle back to the starting position with control.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Use a cable machine with a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with good form.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on lifting with your shoulders, not your traps, to effectively target the lateral deltoids.
